disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Moderate ozone air pollution forecast valid from Friday 3 June to end of Friday 3 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Friday will be mainly sunny with cloud cover later in the day. <br/>Back trajectories are indicating that the air will have circulated over the North Sea and over northern part of Germany and Netherlands before arrival to the UK so might bring some pollution import.<br/><br/>The formation of ground-level ozone is expected as locally emitted and longer-range pollutants from the Continent react photochemically in sunny weather, however this may be limited by lower temperatures. Possible 'Moderate' ozone is  likely at background locations across Greater London.  <br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' for the following pollutants throughout the forecast period:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 4 June to end of Sunday 5 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Saturday and Sunday will have occasional heavy and thundery showers spreading across all parts. Generally cloudy with a slight north easterly air flow.  <br/> <br/>Currently back trajectories are indicating that the air will have circulated over the North Sea before arrival to the UK so should be relatively 'clean' with little pollution import.<br/><br/>With adequate dispersion of local emissions, air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
